channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: COVID-19 infections in Philippines breach 29,000 with 943 new cases
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: (Update 1, 7:36 p.m.) More than 8.38 million cases of the coronavirus, including around 450,000 deaths, have been logged globally by the World Health Organization in its latest situation report.

item.title: Philippines among 10 worst countries for workers in 2020
item.author: Artemio Dumlao
item.description: The 2020 Global Rights Index by the International Trade Union Confederation named the Philippines as among the top 10 dangerous places for workers.

item.title: Motorcycle back-riding to be allowed soon ‘in principle’ in task force guidelines — Palace
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: "Pinapayagan na in-principle ang back-riding upon the approval of the requirements na ise-set ng technical working group."

item.title: Oxfam: Over half of women shoulder more household work amid COVID-19 pandemic
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: “The disproportionate unpaid care work burdens that women face are driven by unwritten rules or shared beliefs about the ‘traditional’ role of women.”

item.title: Government urged to implement Universal Health Care Law
item.description: Sen. Bong Go urged the executive department to ensure the timely implementation of the Universal Health Care law following the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. recommendation to delay it.

item.title: Leachon hits politics, ‘arbitrary’ ouster
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: Aside from problems on data, sacked special adviser to the National Task Force on COVID-19 Anthony Leachon said Thursday night that the country’s response to the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic is beset by politics.

item.title: NPC, House leaders honor Danding
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: Leaders of the Nationalist People’s Coalition yesterday paid tribute to their chairman emeritus Danding Cojuangco, who passed away last June 16.

item.title: PhilHealth denies link to hospital closures from unpaid claims
item.description: The Philippine Health Insurance Corp. yesterday reiterated its denial of the Private Hospitals Association of the Philippines Inc. allegation that 300 hospitals in the country face closure because of delayed payment of claims.

item.title: PLDT-Smart free app tapped for cash aid
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: Leading telco group PLDT-Smart is providing free access to all Smart, TNT and SUN subscribers for the use of ReliefAgad mobile app being tapped by the Department of Social Welfare and Development for the distribution of the second tranche of P5,000 to P8,000 emergency cash subsidy under the administration’s Social Amelioration Program.

item.title: Angkas submits COVID safety protocols to IATF
item.author: Richmond Mercurio
item.description: As it awaits the decision on the legalization of motorcycle taxis, Angkas has come up with a set of innovative health and safety guidelines to prevent the spread of coronavirus disease 2019.
